titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Moore family cemetery plot records 1988.049
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-09-20 15:53:08 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Cypress Hills Cemetery (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.)

did.abstract: This collection contains a Cypress Hills Cemetery deed from 1854 for members of the Moore family, as well as accompanying documents relating to the plot, such as rules and regulations and receipts of donations to the Perpetual Care Fund.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Moore family cemetery plot records, 1988.049; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains a Cypress Hills Cemetery deed from 1854 for members of the Moore family, as well as accompanying documents relating to the plot, such as rules and regulations and receipts of donations to the Perpetual Care Fund.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
